summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The BITMASKS macro retrieves the color masks from a VIDEOINFO structure.

member.name: Windows.BIT_MASKS_MATCH

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The BIT_MASKS_MATCH macro compares the color masks for two VIDEOINFO structures.

member.param: Pointer to the first VIDEOINFO structure.
Pointer to the second VIDEOINFO structure.

The DIBSIZE macro calculates the number of bytes required by a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

The HEADER macro returns the address of the within a VIDEOINFOHEADER.

The MPEG1_SEQUENCE_INFO macro returns the address of the sequence header inside an MPEG1VIDEOINFO structure.

The PALETTE_ENTRIES macro retrieves the maximum number of colors in the palette of a specified bitmap.

The PALETTISED macro checks whether a bitmap has a color depth of 8 bits or less.

[The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The RESET_HEADER macro fills a VIDEOINFOHEADER with zeroes. You can also use this macro to clear just the VIDEOINFOHEADER portion of a VIDEOINFO structure.
This macro is equivalent to calling ZeroMemory with sizeof(VIDEOINFOHEADER).

The RESET_MASKS macro fills the color mask fields in a VIDEOINFO structure with zeroes.

The RESET_PALETTE macro fills the palette entries in a VIDEOINFO structure with zeroes.

The SIZE_MPEG1VIDEOINFO macro calculates the size of an MPEG1VIDEOINFO structure, including the sequence header (bSequenceHeader).
